intro: Gnaphalodes condensata, commonly known as the dense bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, blue to purple flowers are arranged in dense clusters, giving it its common name. Gnaphalodes condensata is known for its aromatic leaves and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
